title: Foundations
subtitle: The atomic units of intelligence
description: Master the underlying mechanics of large language models before progressing through the fluency levels. Understand tokens, context windows, probabilistic prediction, and the mathematical foundations that sustain AI — linear algebra, calculus, probability, and optimization theory.

title: Casual Consumer
subtitle: From magic box to inference engine
description: Develop intuition for AI capabilities through direct interaction with web-based interfaces. Transition from viewing AI as a magic box to understanding it as an inference engine that predicts responses from training knowledge. Learn inference versus training, probabilistic outputs, and basic prompting for summarization, drafting, and brainstorming.

title: Prompt Engineer
subtitle: Precise instructional design for AI
description: Move from casual conversation to precise instructional design. Master advanced prompting techniques including zero-shot, few-shot in-context learning, chain-of-thought reasoning, and role simulation. Control model behavior through temperature, system messages, and delimiters. Employ controlled hallucination and recursive self-improvement strategies.

title: Context Engineer
subtitle: Grounding AI in external data
description: Move beyond the model's internal weights to include external, proprietary data. Specialize in grounding AI through Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), vector databases, and embedding pipelines. Master the full lifecycle of document processing — ingestion, chunking, indexing, and retrieval — to ensure factual accuracy and domain relevance.

title: AI Component Engineer
subtitle: AI as a modular software component
description: Treat AI as a modular component within broader software architecture. Bridge conventional software engineering with the unique nature of AI models using AI Systems Engineering Patterns. Master async parallelism, deterministic wrappers, context engineering, vectorize integration, CI/CD for models, and fallback strategies between frontier and local models.

title: AI System Engineer
subtitle: Orchestrating complex agentic workflows
description: Orchestrate complex, multi-stage agentic workflows. Understand the deep architecture of transformers — self-attention mechanisms, multi-head attention, and parallel processing. Master fine-tuning and domain adaptation for specialized industries. Evaluate system reliability through LLM-as-a-judge, perplexity metrics, and adversarial robustness testing.

title: AI Platformizer
subtitle: Scaling AI across the enterprise
description: Focus on infrastructure and governance required to scale AI organization-wide. Standardize the AI Stack for secure, efficient team usage. Manage MLOps including inference serving, LoRA/QLoRA optimization, monitoring, drift detection, and cost management. Bridge technical teams and executive leadership through strategic adoption, governance frameworks, and compliance with regulations like the EU AI Act.

title: AI Pioneer
subtitle: Pushing the boundaries of the field
description: Push the boundaries of AI through fundamental research and innovation. Focus on long-term societal impacts including AI alignment, emergent behavior detection, and AIGC ethics. Engage with frontier research through institutions like the Vector Institute, contribute to NeurIPS and CVPR proceedings, and address challenges of deepfakes, misinformation, and preserving human creativity.
